Context: The Work-Integrated Learning Office at George Brown College offers various experiential learning opportunities for students and programs. These opportunities include field experience, field placements, co-ops, international WIL, and entrepreneurship. Students can connect with employers through an online platform called Riipen, and there are opportunities for research and innovation collaborations. The college also has a new Brookfield Sustainability Institute that will soon offer experiential and WIL opportunities. Interested individuals can contact the Work-Integrated Learning Office at wil@georgebrown.ca or (416) 415-5000, ext. 3956 for more information. The college also has a land acknowledgment and offers application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and other updates through signing up on their website. The contact numbers for general inquiries are 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559, and the email address is ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The college's social media hub can also be visited for more information. The information on the website is subject to change without notice.
